problems.title: Minimum Number of Arrows to Burst Balloons
problems.description:
Problem Statement

There are N spherical balloons in 2D space. Each balloon i is represented by its horizontal diameter [start[i], end[i]].

An arrow shot vertically at position x will burst all balloons where start[i] <= x <= end[i].

Find the minimum number of arrows needed to burst all balloons.

Greedy Insight: Similar to interval scheduling - sort by end points and shoot at overlapping regions.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
10 16
2 8
1 6
7 12

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
Balloons: [(10,16), (2,8), (1,6), (7,12)]
Sorted by end: [(1,6), (2,8), (7,12), (10,16)]

Arrow 1 at x=6: Bursts balloons (1,6) and (2,8)
Arrow 2 at x=12: Bursts balloons (7,12) and (10,16)

Minimum arrows = 2

class Solution:
    def minArrows(self, balloons):

        # Greedily shoot arrow at the end of first unpopped balloon

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n = int(data[0])
    balloons = []
    for i in range(1, n + 1):
        s, e = map(int, data[i].split())
        balloons.append((s, e))
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.minArrows(balloons))

hintsList: Sort balloons by their end position. This helps us find overlapping balloons efficiently.
Shoot an arrow at the end of the current balloon. All balloons whose start <= arrow position get burst. Move to next unpopped balloon.
